lines.text: Bess. I... I think you've got yourself involved in something that is out of your control.
Have I?

[sighs]
Come on Bess. You're not a kid anymore.
Look for Christ's sake, he's... he's forcing you to get screwed by every Tom, Dick and Harry... it's just not you.
I don't make love with them. I make love with Jan, and I save him from dying.

[exhales]
Well I'm sorry, but, you know, to me seems more like a dirty old man who wants to play the Peeping Tom.
Sometimes... I don't even have to tell him about it.
Jan and me... we have a spiritual contact.
God gives everyone something to be good at. I've always been stupid... but I'm good at this.
God gives everyone a talent.
What's Jan talent?
He is... He's a great lover.
Well, what's... what's mine, then?
I don't know.
Haven't you find it yet?

[chuckles]
I see... And what's your talent Bess? Because, um, surely it can't be being screwed by men you've never seen before.
I can believe.
Not one of you has the right to consign Bess to hell!
I don't understand what you're saying. How can you love a word? You cannot love words. You can't be in love with a word. You can only love another human being. That's perfection.
Can you think of anything of real value that the outsiders have brought with them?
Uh... their music!

[he writes in a paper]
Let me die. I'm evil in head!
I love you no matter what is in your head!
We do not need bells in our church to worship God.
[first lines]
His name is Jan.
I do not know him.

[coyly]
He's from the lake.
You know we do not favor matrimony with outsiders.
Can you even tell us what matrimony is?
It's when two people are joined in God.
Love is a mighty power, isn't it?
I would say to you that if there is one of these commandments you do not love and do not obey, you have no business at the Lord's table.
Listen man, you had the deceased in your care. The court would like to hear the medical facts.
If... if you'd, um... if you were to ask me again to write... um... the conclusion, then... instead of writing "neurotic" or, um, "psychotic" uh, I might... just, um... use a word like... "good".
Good?
Yes.
You wish the records of this court to state that, in your medical opinion, the deceased was suffering from being good?
Perhaps this was the psychological defect that led her to her death!
Is that what we shall write Doctor Richardson?

[pause]
No. Of course not.
I don't make love with them, I make love with Jan and I save him from dying.
We Think he will be completely paralyzed. But he'll live.
